vulnerabilities.title: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
vulnerabilities.name: apt/libapt-pkg5.0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
It was found that apt-key in apt, all versions, do not correctly validate gpg keys with the master keyring, leading to a potential man-in-the-middle attack.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=642480)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-3374)
- [MISC](https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2011/CVE-2011-3374.html)
- [MISC](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-LINUX-APT-116518)
- [RedHat CVE Database](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2011-3374)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: apt/libapt-pkg5.0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Missing input validation in the ar/tar implementations of APT before version 2.1.2 could result in denial of service when processing specially crafted deb files.

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-3810)
- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4359-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-18276
vulnerabilities.name: bash
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in disable_priv_mode in shell.c in GNU Bash through 5.0 patch 11. By default, if Bash is run with its effective UID not equal to its real UID, it will drop privileges by setting its effective UID to its real UID. However, it does so incorrectly. On Linux and other systems that support "saved UID" functionality, the saved UID is not dropped. An attacker with command execution in the shell can use "enable -f" for runtime loading of a new builtin, which can be a shared object that calls setuid() and therefore regains privileges. However, binaries running with an effective UID of 0 are unaffected.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-18276)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/bminor/bash/commit/951bdaad7a18cc0dc1036bba86b18b90874d39ff)
- [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/155498/Bash-5.0-Patch-11-Privilege-Escalation.html)
- [MISC](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-wGtxJ8opa8)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-18276)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: coreutils
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2781)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/2)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/3)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-2781)

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.name: coreutils
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
In GNU Coreutils through 8.29, chown-core.c in chown and chgrp does not prevent replacement of a plain file with a symlink during use of the POSIX "-R -L" options, which allows local users to modify the ownership of arbitrary files by leveraging a race condition.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-18018)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-18018)
- [http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/coreutils/2017-12/msg00045.html](http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/coreutils/2017-12/msg00045.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: gcc-8/libstdc++6
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://gcc.gnu.org/viewcvs/gcc/trunk/gcc/config/arm/arm-protos.h?revision=266379&view=markup)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-12886)
- [MISC](https://www.gnu.org/software/gcc/gcc-8/changes.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Insufficient Entropy
vulnerabilities.name: gcc-8/libstdc++6
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The POWER9 backend in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) before version 10 could optimize multiple calls of the __builtin_darn intrinsic into a single call, thus reducing the entropy of the random number generator. This occurred because a volatile operation was not specified. For example, within a single execution of a program, the output of every __builtin_darn() call may be the same.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-15847)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=91481)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00056.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00057.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
** DISPUTED ** In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(|)(\\1\\1)*' in grep, a different issue than CVE-2018-20796. NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability because the behavior occurs only with a crafted pattern.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K26346590?utm_source=f5support&amp%3Butm_medium=RSS)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9192)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24269)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9192)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\\1\\1|t1|\\\2537)+' in grep.

## References

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.25 and earlier, when invoked with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10228)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/03/01/10)

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10228)
- [https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Stack consumption vulnerability in the regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via a regular expression containing adjacent repetition operators, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD.

## References
- [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/515589/100/0/threaded)
- [Cert Vulnerability Note](http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/912279)
- [Dead Link](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/515589/100/0/threaded)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4052)
- [Exploit DB](http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/15935)
- [MISC](http://cxib.net/stuff/proftpd.gnu.c)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=645859)
- [SECTRACK](http://securitytracker.com/id?1024832)
- [SREASON](http://securityreason.com/securityalert/8003)
- [SREASONRES](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/93)
- [Seclists Full Disclosure](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2011/Jan/78)
- [Secunia Advisory](http://secunia.com/advisories/42547)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/45233)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The glob implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via crafted glob expressions that do not match any pathnames, as demonstrated by glob expressions in STAT commands to an FTP daemon, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2632.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4756)
- [http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c](http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c)
- [http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89)
- [http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223](http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2010-4051
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a regular expression containing adjacent bounded repetitions that bypass the intended RE_DUP_MAX limitation, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD, related to a "RE_DUP_MAX overflow."

## References

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded libray with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code.

vulnerabilities.title: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may guess the heap addresses of pthread_created thread. The component is: glibc. NOTE: the vendor's position is "ASLR bypass itself is not a vulnerability."

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06046097)

- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22853)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
On the x86-64 architecture, the GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.31 fails to ignore the LD_PREFER_MAP_32BIT_EXEC environment variable during program execution after a security transition, allowing local attackers to restrict the possible mapping addresses for loaded libraries and thus bypass ASLR for a setuid program.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19126)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4FQ5LC6JOYSOYFPRUZ4S45KL6IP3RPPZ/)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZFJ5E7NWOL6ROE5QVICHKIOUGCPFJVUH/)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25204)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19126)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1751)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1751)

- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0002/)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1751)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25414)
- [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git%3Bh=ddc650e9b3dc916eab417ce9f79e67337b05035c)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620)
- [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
** DISPUTED ** In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(|)(\\1\\1)*' in grep, a different issue than CVE-2018-20796. NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability because the behavior occurs only with a crafted pattern.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K26346590?utm_source=f5support&amp%3Butm_medium=RSS)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9192)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24269)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9192)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\\1\\1|t1|\\\2537)+' in grep.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.25 and earlier, when invoked with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10228)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Stack consumption vulnerability in the regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via a regular expression containing adjacent repetition operators, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD.

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The glob implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via crafted glob expressions that do not match any pathnames, as demonstrated by glob expressions in STAT commands to an FTP daemon, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2632.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4756)
- [http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c](http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c)
- [http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89)
- [http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223](http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2010-4051
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a regular expression containing adjacent bounded repetitions that bypass the intended RE_DUP_MAX limitation, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD, related to a "RE_DUP_MAX overflow."

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.25 and earlier, when invoked with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10228)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Stack consumption vulnerability in the regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via a regular expression containing adjacent repetition operators, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD.

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The glob implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via crafted glob expressions that do not match any pathnames, as demonstrated by glob expressions in STAT commands to an FTP daemon, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2632.

## References

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2010-4051
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a regular expression containing adjacent bounded repetitions that bypass the intended RE_DUP_MAX limitation, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD, related to a "RE_DUP_MAX overflow."

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded libray with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code.

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
On the x86-64 architecture, the GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.31 fails to ignore the LD_PREFER_MAP_32BIT_EXEC environment variable during program execution after a security transition, allowing local attackers to restrict the possible mapping addresses for loaded libraries and thus bypass ASLR for a setuid program.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19126)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4FQ5LC6JOYSOYFPRUZ4S45KL6IP3RPPZ/)

- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25204)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19126)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32.

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-dev-bin
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/)

- [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6-dev
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
** DISPUTED ** In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(|)(\\1\\1)*' in grep, a different issue than CVE-2018-20796. NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability because the behavior occurs only with a crafted pattern.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6-dev
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6-dev
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6-dev
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32.

## References

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6-dev
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/)

vulnerabilities.name: gnupg2/gpgv

A flaw was found in the way certificate signatures could be forged using collisions found in the SHA-1 algorithm. An attacker could use this weakness to create forged certificate signatures. This issue affects GnuPG versions before 2.2.18.

The SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a "BEAST" attack.

vulnerabilities.title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.name: gnutls28/libgnutls30
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
GnuTLS 3.6.x before 3.6.13 uses incorrect cryptography for DTLS. The earliest affected version is 3.6.3 (2018-07-16) because of an error in a 2017-10-06 commit. The DTLS client always uses 32 '\0' bytes instead of a random value, and thus contributes no randomness to a DTLS negotiation. This breaks the security guarantees of the DTLS protocol.

## References
- [Debian Security Advisory](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4652)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11501)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ILMOWPKMTZAIMK5F32TUMO34XCABUCFJ/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/WDYY3R4F5CUTFAMXH2C5NKYFVDEJLTT7/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202004-06)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/-/commit/5b595e8e52653f6c5726a4cdd8fddeb6e83804d2)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/-/issues/960)
- [MISC](https://www.gnutls.org/security-new.html%23GNUTLS-SA-2020-03-31)

vulnerabilities.title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.name: gnutls28/libgnutls30
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm. GnuTLS 3.6.x before 3.6.14 uses incorrect cryptography for encrypting a session ticket (a loss of confidentiality in TLS 1.2, and an authentication bypass in TLS 1.3). The earliest affected version is 3.6.4 (2018-09-24) because of an error in a 2018-09-18 commit. Until the first key rotation, the TLS server always uses wrong data in place of an encryption key derived from an application.
## Remediation
Upgrade `gnutls28` to version  or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.name: gnutls28/libgnutls30
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
GnuTLS 3.6.x before 3.6.13 uses incorrect cryptography for DTLS. The earliest affected version is 3.6.3 (2018-07-16) because of an error in a 2017-10-06 commit. The DTLS client always uses 32 '\0' bytes instead of a random value, and thus contributes no randomness to a DTLS negotiation. This breaks the security guarantees of the DTLS protocol.

## References
- [Debian Security Advisory](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4652)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11501)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ILMOWPKMTZAIMK5F32TUMO34XCABUCFJ/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/WDYY3R4F5CUTFAMXH2C5NKYFVDEJLTT7/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202004-06)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/-/commit/5b595e8e52653f6c5726a4cdd8fddeb6e83804d2)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/-/issues/960)
- [MISC](https://www.gnutls.org/security-new.html%23GNUTLS-SA-2020-03-31)

vulnerabilities.title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.name: gnutls28/libgnutls30
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm. GnuTLS 3.6.x before 3.6.14 uses incorrect cryptography for encrypting a session ticket (a loss of confidentiality in TLS 1.2, and an authentication bypass in TLS 1.3). The earliest affected version is 3.6.4 (2018-09-24) because of an error in a 2018-09-18 commit. Until the first key rotation, the TLS server always uses wrong data in place of an encryption key derived from an application.
## Remediation
Upgrade `gnutls28` to version  or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
cipher/elgamal.c in Libgcrypt through 1.8.2, when used to encrypt messages directly, improperly encodes plaintexts, which allows attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading ciphertext data (i.e., it does not have semantic security in face of a ciphertext-only attack). The Decisional Diffie-Hellman (DDH) assumption does not hold for Libgcrypt's ElGamal implementation.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6829)
- [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal)
- [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal/wiki)
- [MISC](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gcrypt-devel/2018-February/004394.html)
- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2020.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
In Libgcrypt 1.8.4, the C implementation of AES is vulnerable to a flush-and-reload side-channel attack because physical addresses are available to other processes. (The C implementation is used on platforms where an assembly-language implementation is unavailable.)

## References

- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/commit/daedbbb5541cd8ecda1459d3b843ea4d92788762)
- [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T4541)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-07/msg00049.html)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-12904)

vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

It was discovered that there was a ECDSA timing attack in the libgcrypt20 cryptographic library. Version affected: 1.8.4-5, 1.7.6-2+deb9u3, and 1.6.3-2+deb8u4. Versions fixed: 1.8.5-2 and 1.6.3-2+deb8u7.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: libidn2/libidn2-0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
GNU libidn2 before 2.2.0 fails to perform the roundtrip checks specified in RFC3490 Section 4.2 when converting A-labels to U-labels. This makes it possible in some circumstances for one domain to impersonate another. By creating a malicious domain that matches a target domain except for the inclusion of certain punycoded Unicode characters (that would be discarded when converted first to a Unicode label and then back to an ASCII label), arbitrary domains can be impersonated.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/commit/614117ef6e4c60e1950d742e3edf0a0ef8d389de)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-12290)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/commit/241e8f486134793cb0f4a5b0e5817a97883401f5)
- [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/merge_requests/71)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-12290)
- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4168-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: libseccomp/libseccomp2
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
libseccomp before 2.4.0 did not correctly generate 64-bit syscall argument comparisons using the arithmetic operators (LT, GT, LE, GE), which might able to lead to bypassing seccomp filters and potential privilege escalations.

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.name: libtasn1-6
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
GNU Libtasn1-4.13 libtasn1-4.13 version libtasn1-4.13, libtasn1-4.12 contains a DoS, specifically CPU usage will reach 100% when running asn1Paser against the POC due to an issue in _asn1_expand_object_id(p_tree), after a long time, the program will be killed. This attack appears to be exploitable via parsing a crafted file.

vulnerabilities.title: Buffer Overflow
vulnerabilities.name: lz4/liblz4-1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
LZ4 before 1.9.2 has a heap-based buffer overflow in LZ4_write32 (related to LZ4_compress_destSize), affecting applications that call LZ4_compress_fast with a large input. (This issue can also lead to data corruption.) NOTE: the vendor states "only a few specific / uncommon usages of the API are at risk."

vulnerabilities.title: Buffer Overflow
vulnerabilities.name: lz4/liblz4-1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
LZ4 before 1.9.2 has a heap-based buffer overflow in LZ4_write32 (related to LZ4_compress_destSize), affecting applications that call LZ4_compress_fast with a large input. (This issue can also lead to data corruption.) NOTE: the vendor states "only a few specific / uncommon usages of the API are at risk."

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl1.1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The NIST SP 800-90A default statement of the Dual Elliptic Curve Deterministic Random Bit Generation (Dual_EC_DRBG) algorithm contains point Q constants with a possible relationship to certain "skeleton key" values, which might allow context-dependent attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms by leveraging knowledge of those values.  NOTE: this is a preliminary CVE for Dual_EC_DRBG; future research may provide additional details about point Q and associated attacks, and could potentially lead to a RECAST or REJECT of this CVE.

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl1.1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
OpenSSL 0.9.8i on the Gaisler Research LEON3 SoC on the Xilinx Virtex-II Pro FPGA uses a Fixed Width Exponentiation (FWE) algorithm for certain signature calculations, and does not verify the signature before providing it to a caller, which makes it easier for physically proximate attackers to determine the private key via a modified supply voltage for the microprocessor, related to a "fault-based attack."

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl1.1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
There is an overflow bug in the x64_64 Montgomery squaring procedure used in exponentiation with 512-bit moduli. No EC algorithms are affected. Analysis suggests that attacks against 2-prime RSA1024, 3-prime RSA1536, and DSA1024 as a result of this defect would be very difficult to perform and are not believed likely. Attacks against DH512 are considered just feasible. However, for an attack the target would have to re-use the DH512 private key, which is not recommended anyway. Also applications directly using the low level API BN_mod_exp may be affected if they use BN_FLG_CONSTTIME. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1e (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1d). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2u (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2t).

## References

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl1.1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Server or client applications that call the SSL_check_chain() function during or after a TLS 1.3 handshake may crash due to a NULL pointer dereference as a result of incorrect handling of the "signature_algorithms_cert" TLS extension. The crash occurs if an invalid or unrecognised signature algorithm is received from the peer. This could be exploited by a malicious peer in a Denial of Service attack. OpenSSL version 1.1.1d, 1.1.1e, and 1.1.1f are affected by this issue. This issue did not affect OpenSSL versions prior to 1.1.1d. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1g (Affected 1.1.1d-1.1.1f).

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl1.1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
The NIST SP 800-90A default statement of the Dual Elliptic Curve Deterministic Random Bit Generation (Dual_EC_DRBG) algorithm contains point Q constants with a possible relationship to certain "skeleton key" values, which might allow context-dependent attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms by leveraging knowledge of those values.  NOTE: this is a preliminary CVE for Dual_EC_DRBG; future research may provide additional details about point Q and associated attacks, and could potentially lead to a RECAST or REJECT of this CVE.

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl1.1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
OpenSSL 0.9.8i on the Gaisler Research LEON3 SoC on the Xilinx Virtex-II Pro FPGA uses a Fixed Width Exponentiation (FWE) algorithm for certain signature calculations, and does not verify the signature before providing it to a caller, which makes it easier for physically proximate attackers to determine the private key via a modified supply voltage for the microprocessor, related to a "fault-based attack."

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl1.1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
There is an overflow bug in the x64_64 Montgomery squaring procedure used in exponentiation with 512-bit moduli. No EC algorithms are affected. Analysis suggests that attacks against 2-prime RSA1024, 3-prime RSA1536, and DSA1024 as a result of this defect would be very difficult to perform and are not believed likely. Attacks against DH512 are considered just feasible. However, for an attack the target would have to re-use the DH512 private key, which is not recommended anyway. Also applications directly using the low level API BN_mod_exp may be affected if they use BN_FLG_CONSTTIME. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1e (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1d). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2u (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2t).

## References

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl1.1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Server or client applications that call the SSL_check_chain() function during or after a TLS 1.3 handshake may crash due to a NULL pointer dereference as a result of incorrect handling of the "signature_algorithms_cert" TLS extension. The crash occurs if an invalid or unrecognised signature algorithm is received from the peer. This could be exploited by a malicious peer in a Denial of Service attack. OpenSSL version 1.1.1d, 1.1.1e, and 1.1.1f are affected by this issue. This issue did not affect OpenSSL versions prior to 1.1.1d. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1g (Affected 1.1.1d-1.1.1f).

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl-dev
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
There is an overflow bug in the x64_64 Montgomery squaring procedure used in exponentiation with 512-bit moduli. No EC algorithms are affected. Analysis suggests that attacks against 2-prime RSA1024, 3-prime RSA1536, and DSA1024 as a result of this defect would be very difficult to perform and are not believed likely. Attacks against DH512 are considered just feasible. However, for an attack the target would have to re-use the DH512 private key, which is not recommended anyway. Also applications directly using the low level API BN_mod_exp may be affected if they use BN_FLG_CONSTTIME. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1e (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1d). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2u (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2t).

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl-dev
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Server or client applications that call the SSL_check_chain() function during or after a TLS 1.3 handshake may crash due to a NULL pointer dereference as a result of incorrect handling of the "signature_algorithms_cert" TLS extension. The crash occurs if an invalid or unrecognised signature algorithm is received from the peer. This could be exploited by a malicious peer in a Denial of Service attack. OpenSSL version 1.1.1d, 1.1.1e, and 1.1.1f are affected by this issue. This issue did not affect OpenSSL versions prior to 1.1.1d. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1g (Affected 1.1.1d-1.1.1f).

vulnerabilities.title: Security Features
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in shadow 4.5. newgidmap (in shadow-utils) is setuid and allows an unprivileged user to be placed in a user namespace where setgroups(2) is permitted. This allows an attacker to remove themselves from a supplementary group, which may allow access to certain filesystem paths if the administrator has used "group blacklisting" (e.g., chmod g-rwx) to restrict access to paths. This flaw effectively reverts a security feature in the kernel (in particular, the /proc/self/setgroups knob) to prevent this sort of privilege escalation.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-7169)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201805-09)
- [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/%2Bsource/shadow/%2Bbug/1729357)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-7169)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
initscripts in rPath Linux 1 sets insecure permissions for the /var/log/btmp file, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information regarding authentication attempts.  NOTE: because sshd detects the insecure permissions and does not log certain events, this also prevents sshd from logging failed authentication attempts by remote attackers.

## References

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
shadow 4.8, in certain circumstances affecting at least Gentoo, Arch Linux, and Void Linux, allows local users to obtain root access because setuid programs are misconfigured. Specifically, this affects shadow 4.8 when compiled using --with-libpam but without explicitly passing --disable-account-tools-setuid, and without a PAM configuration suitable for use with setuid account management tools. This combination leads to account management tools (groupadd, groupdel, groupmod, useradd, userdel, usermod) that can easily be used by unprivileged local users to escalate privileges to root in multiple ways. This issue became much more relevant in approximately December 2019 when an unrelated bug was fixed (i.e., the chmod calls to suidusbins were fixed in the upstream Makefile which is now included in the release version 4.8).

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19882)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202008-09)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/shadow-maint/shadow/commit/edf7547ad5aa650be868cf2dac58944773c12d75)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/shadow-maint/shadow/pull/199)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/void-linux/void-packages/pull/17580)
- [MISC](https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/64836)
- [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/702252)

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
shadow 4.8, in certain circumstances affecting at least Gentoo, Arch Linux, and Void Linux, allows local users to obtain root access because setuid programs are misconfigured. Specifically, this affects shadow 4.8 when compiled using --with-libpam but without explicitly passing --disable-account-tools-setuid, and without a PAM configuration suitable for use with setuid account management tools. This combination leads to account management tools (groupadd, groupdel, groupmod, useradd, userdel, usermod) that can easily be used by unprivileged local users to escalate privileges to root in multiple ways. This issue became much more relevant in approximately December 2019 when an unrelated bug was fixed (i.e., the chmod calls to suidusbins were fixed in the upstream Makefile which is now included in the release version 4.8).

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19882)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202008-09)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/shadow-maint/shadow/commit/edf7547ad5aa650be868cf2dac58944773c12d75)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/shadow-maint/shadow/pull/199)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/void-linux/void-packages/pull/17580)
- [MISC](https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/64836)
- [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/702252)

vulnerabilities.title: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU)
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/login
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
shadow: TOCTOU (time-of-check time-of-use) race condition when copying and removing directory trees

## References

- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2013-4235)
- [RedHat CVE Database](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2013-4235)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2013-4235)

vulnerabilities.title: Security Features
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/login
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in shadow 4.5. newgidmap (in shadow-utils) is setuid and allows an unprivileged user to be placed in a user namespace where setgroups(2) is permitted. This allows an attacker to remove themselves from a supplementary group, which may allow access to certain filesystem paths if the administrator has used "group blacklisting" (e.g., chmod g-rwx) to restrict access to paths. This flaw effectively reverts a security feature in the kernel (in particular, the /proc/self/setgroups knob) to prevent this sort of privilege escalation.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-7169)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201805-09)
- [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/%2Bsource/shadow/%2Bbug/1729357)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-7169)

vulnerabilities.name: shadow/login
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
initscripts in rPath Linux 1 sets insecure permissions for the /var/log/btmp file, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information regarding authentication attempts.  NOTE: because sshd detects the insecure permissions and does not log certain events, this also prevents sshd from logging failed authentication attempts by remote attackers.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3/libsqlite3-0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read. An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5, iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2, iCloud for Windows 7.19. A malicious application may cause a denial of service or potentially disclose memory contents.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `sqlite3`.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Use After Free ext/fts3/fts3.c in SQLite before 3.32.0 has a use-after-free in fts3EvalNextRow, related to the snippet feature.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `sqlite3`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13630)

- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4394-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to NULL Pointer Dereference ext/fts3/fts3_snippet.c in SQLite before 3.32.0 has a NULL pointer dereference via a crafted matchinfo() query.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `sqlite3`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read. An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5, iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2, iCloud for Windows 7.19. A malicious application may cause a denial of service or potentially disclose memory contents.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `sqlite3`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-9794)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-9794)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Use After Free. SQLite 3.32.2 has a use-after-free in resetAccumulator in select.c because the parse tree rewrite for window functions is too late.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `sqlite3`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13871)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200619-0002/)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write. In SQLite before 3.32.3, select.c mishandles query-flattener optimization, leading to a multiSelectOrderBy heap overflow because of misuse of transitive properties for constant propagation.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `sqlite3`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-15358)
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-15358)

- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202007-26)
- [MISC](https://www.sqlite.org/src/info/10fa79d00f8091e5)
- [MISC](https://www.sqlite.org/src/timeline?p=version-3.32.3&bt=version-3.32.2)
- [MISC](https://www.sqlite.org/src/tktview?name=8f157e8010)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4438-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
systemd, when updating file permissions, allows local users to change the permissions and SELinux security contexts for arbitrary files via a symlink attack on unspecified files.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=725357)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-4392)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/10/01/9)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=859060)

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
CVE-2019-9619

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9619)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can get new privileges through the execution of SUID binaries, which would allow to create binaries owned by the service transient group with the setgid bit set. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the GID will be recycled.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3844)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3844)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108096)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3844)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can create a SUID/SGID binary that would be allowed to run as the transient service UID/GID even after the service is terminated. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the UID/GID will be recycled.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3843)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/5JXQAKSTMABZ46EVCRMW62DHWYHTTFES/)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3843)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108116)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3843)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
systemd 242 changes the VT1 mode upon a logout, which allows attackers to read cleartext passwords in certain circumstances, such as watching a shutdown, or using Ctrl-Alt-F1 and Ctrl-Alt-F2. This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20839)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/9725f1a10f80f5e0ae7d9b60547458622aeb322f)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/12378)
- [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/%2Bsource/systemd/%2Bbug/1803993)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190530-0002/)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108389)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20839)

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in button_open in login/logind-button.c in systemd before 243. When executing the udevadm trigger command, a memory leak may occur.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20386)

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20386)
- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A heap use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd before version v245-rc1, where asynchronous Polkit queries are performed while handling dbus messages. A local unprivileged attacker can abuse this flaw to crash systemd services or potentially execute code and elevate their privileges, by sending specially crafted dbus messages.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1712)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/1068447e6954dc6ce52f099ed174c442cb89ed54)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/637486261528e8aa3da9f26a4487dc254f4b7abb)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/bc130b6858327b382b07b3985cf48e2aa9016b2d)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/ea0d0ede03c6f18dbc5036c5e9cccf97e415ccc2)
- [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/02/05/1)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1712)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1712)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation systemd through v245 mishandles numerical usernames such as ones composed of decimal digits or 0x followed by hex digits, as demonstrated by use of root privileges when privileges of the 0x0 user account were intended. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `systemd`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13776)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0003/)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A heap use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd before version v245-rc1, where asynchronous Polkit queries are performed while handling dbus messages. A local unprivileged attacker can abuse this flaw to crash systemd services or potentially execute code and elevate their privileges, by sending specially crafted dbus messages.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1712)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/1068447e6954dc6ce52f099ed174c442cb89ed54)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/637486261528e8aa3da9f26a4487dc254f4b7abb)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/bc130b6858327b382b07b3985cf48e2aa9016b2d)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/ea0d0ede03c6f18dbc5036c5e9cccf97e415ccc2)
- [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/02/05/1)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1712)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1712)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation systemd through v245 mishandles numerical usernames such as ones composed of decimal digits or 0x followed by hex digits, as demonstrated by use of root privileges when privileges of the 0x0 user account were intended. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `systemd`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13776)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0003/)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13776)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IYGLFEKG45EYBJ7TPQMLWROWPTZBEU63/)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/15985)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
systemd, when updating file permissions, allows local users to change the permissions and SELinux security contexts for arbitrary files via a symlink attack on unspecified files.

## References
- [Debian Bug Report](http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=725357)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-4392)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/10/01/9)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=859060)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can get new privileges through the execution of SUID binaries, which would allow to create binaries owned by the service transient group with the setgid bit set. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the GID will be recycled.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3844)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3844)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108096)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3844)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can create a SUID/SGID binary that would be allowed to run as the transient service UID/GID even after the service is terminated. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the UID/GID will be recycled.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3843)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/5JXQAKSTMABZ46EVCRMW62DHWYHTTFES/)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3843)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108116)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3843)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
systemd 242 changes the VT1 mode upon a logout, which allows attackers to read cleartext passwords in certain circumstances, such as watching a shutdown, or using Ctrl-Alt-F1 and Ctrl-Alt-F2. This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20839)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/9725f1a10f80f5e0ae7d9b60547458622aeb322f)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/12378)
- [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/%2Bsource/systemd/%2Bbug/1803993)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190530-0002/)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108389)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20839)

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in button_open in login/logind-button.c in systemd before 243. When executing the udevadm trigger command, a memory leak may occur.

## References

It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can get new privileges through the execution of SUID binaries, which would allow to create binaries owned by the service transient group with the setgid bit set. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the GID will be recycled.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3844)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3844)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108096)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3844)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can create a SUID/SGID binary that would be allowed to run as the transient service UID/GID even after the service is terminated. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the UID/GID will be recycled.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3843)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/5JXQAKSTMABZ46EVCRMW62DHWYHTTFES/)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3843)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108116)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3843)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
systemd 242 changes the VT1 mode upon a logout, which allows attackers to read cleartext passwords in certain circumstances, such as watching a shutdown, or using Ctrl-Alt-F1 and Ctrl-Alt-F2. This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20839)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/9725f1a10f80f5e0ae7d9b60547458622aeb322f)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/12378)
- [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/%2Bsource/systemd/%2Bbug/1803993)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190530-0002/)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108389)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20839)

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in button_open in login/logind-button.c in systemd before 243. When executing the udevadm trigger command, a memory leak may occur.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20386)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A heap use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd before version v245-rc1, where asynchronous Polkit queries are performed while handling dbus messages. A local unprivileged attacker can abuse this flaw to crash systemd services or potentially execute code and elevate their privileges, by sending specially crafted dbus messages.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1712)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/1068447e6954dc6ce52f099ed174c442cb89ed54)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/637486261528e8aa3da9f26a4487dc254f4b7abb)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/bc130b6858327b382b07b3985cf48e2aa9016b2d)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/ea0d0ede03c6f18dbc5036c5e9cccf97e415ccc2)
- [OSS security Advisory](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/02/05/1)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1712)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1712)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libudev1
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation systemd through v245 mishandles numerical usernames such as ones composed of decimal digits or 0x followed by hex digits, as demonstrated by use of root privileges when privileges of the 0x0 user account were intended. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `systemd`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13776)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0003/)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13776)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IYGLFEKG45EYBJ7TPQMLWROWPTZBEU63/)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/15985)

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2005-2541
vulnerabilities.name: tar
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Tar 1.15.1 does not properly warn the user when extracting setuid or setgid files, which may allow local users or remote attackers to gain privileges.

This is considered intended behaviour, as tar is an archiving tool and one needs to give `-p` as a command line flag

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2005-2541)
- [HP Security Bulletin](http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=112327628230258&w=2)

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.name: tar
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
pax_decode_header in sparse.c in GNU Tar before 1.32 had a NULL pointer dereference when parsing certain archives that have malformed extended headers.

## References

- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00077.html)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9923)
